summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeCreates soft, hydrated & pretty lips with Lanolips Tinted Balm. A superb lanolin-rich lip conditioner + sheer pretty colour tint. Sheer tint gives lips a healthy glow.
details: DetailsBenefitsLanolips Tinted Lip Balms create soft, hydrated, and pretty lipsThe 99% natural formula is made with the world's best lanolin, which holds up to 200 percent of its weight in moisture to provide rich hydrationFeaturesMulti-Award Winning: Won Harpers Bazaar Beauty Hot 100Female-Owned Beauty BrandTSA-Approved, travel friendly beauty productCruelty-FreeCertified by Leaping BunnyVegetarian99% NaturalFormulated WithoutArtificial colors, fragrances, parabens, petrolatum, PEGs, or mineral oilItem 2549500How To UseApply to lips as needed.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsLanolin*, Theobroma Cacao Seed Butter*, Ricinus Communic Seed Oil*, Cera Alba/Beeswax/Cire D'Abeille*, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter*, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil*,Tocopherol (Vit E), (Nat) Aroma*, Prunus Amygdalus (Sweet Almond) Dulcis Oil*, Cocos (Coconut) Nucifera Oil.*May Contain: Hydrogenated Polydecene, Hydroxystearic Acid , Mica (CI 77019), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410), Red 33 Lake (CI 17200), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Red 6 (CI 15850), Iron Oxides (CI 77491) *Naturally Derived.
how_to_use: Apply to lips as needed.Precautions: For external use only.
ingredients: Cocos (Coconut) Nucifera Oil.*May Contain: Hydrogenated Polydecene

reviews.headline: Pretty good
reviews.comments: The only reason I bought this product was because it was on sale and for that price I'm pretty happy with it. It's a nice nude for my skin and somewhat moisturizing for the lips. I do recommend chapstick before applying.

reviews.headline: Great quality
reviews.comments: I got a small sample of this first and liked it. Went to buy it in store and got the same nude color but it was more pink than I thought. Still like it and it lasts long on lips.

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: Nice, light, tinted gloss.

reviews.headline: Perfect tinted lip balm
reviews.comments: The color is gorgeous, and my lips feel so soft after applying!

reviews.headline: Really good product
reviews.comments: i would recommend it

reviews.headline: Pretty
reviews.comments: Its actually so cute. I love how pretty the color is!!

reviews.headline: Hydrating with great color!
reviews.comments: I had heard about Lanolips but hadn't tried any of their products.  I purchased this tinted lip balm and I absolutely love it!  It's very hydrating and nourishing while giving great color that lasts!  It feels good on my lips and I enjoy wearing it as opposed to full-blown lipstick.  I love that the first ingredient is lanolin and it isn't just hidden in the list of ingredients.

reviews.headline: Love!
reviews.comments: My favorite lip balm!  Love the tint and long lasting hydration.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product 1000 times more!
reviews.comments: Great color never lets me down!

reviews.headline: Truly Pigmented
reviews.comments: So many lip balms claim to have a tint but this one actually delivers. It is not sheer or anything like that. Make sure you use a mirror when applying it because otherwise you will look like a clown. Feels so nice on my lips. I have shade Spice.

reviews.headline: Kind of cakey
reviews.comments: Very moisturizing but feels a little cakey. The tube is not user friendly

reviews.headline: Applicator broke… bleh
reviews.comments: I want to love it!! And i would but my applicator tip broke… i dont know how… Color is okay, i thought it would be more pigmented. It does clump if I put too much on, and it could get sticky. I used it in winter and it got sticky with the cold wind, so also a bit disappointing. The trick is to put a light clump on lip and then spread. Also kinda pricey…

reviews.headline: STUNNING!
reviews.comments: this is the best brand of lipglosses I ever tried. This product gave my lips a natural shine and its not sticky at all.

reviews.headline: BEST LIP BALM
reviews.comments: I love love lanolips i have their strawberry ointment balm and their gloss and now i wanted to try their tinted balm and its amazing. So moisturizing my lips stay so soft and hydrated. The nude color is perfect shade. The lip balm smells sooo yummy. The consistancy is thick but once applied its perfect and not sticky at all.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: The product comes out of the tube clumpy, very thick and sticky.

reviews.headline: Really good
reviews.comments: Really good, has nice color and very hydrating, i just dont like the applicator, it makes it come put too thick for an uneven applicatiok but i dont mind leveling it off with my finger

reviews.headline: Really good
reviews.comments: Really good, has nice color and very hydrating, i just dont like the applicator, it makes it come put too thick for an uneven applicatiok but i dont mind leveling it off with my finger

reviews.headline: Goes on so thick
reviews.comments: Was hoping this could be a gloss i put on mindlessly, but you have to look in the mirror or it will be too thick in spots. Was also hoping this would be more similar to their colorless lip tubes, but is smoother, which doesnt stay as well

reviews.headline: I have bought over and over. The best that I have found.
reviews.comments: Keeps my lips hydrated in this cold weather and provides a light tint for us that have pale lips and don't like to use lipstick..

reviews.headline: Just WOW!  OMG!!!  Finally, relief!
reviews.comments: First off, I do NOT do reviews.  I may like something, but generally don't get "wowed" or feel compelled to write anything.  However, with this- just wow!  I have a medical condition that leaves my lips not only chronically dry, but a peeling, bloody mess.  They will literally crack open and bleed.  I have tried everything- and I mean everything.  I hardly wear lipstick because it is too drying.  I have been using primarily Clinique lip balm, but tried this on a whim from an online recommendation.  I was a little nervous of using lanolin- I am allergic to wool and usually avoid lanolin just in case.  I figured, my lips are already a mess, how much worse could they get?  I bought the tinted lip balm in "Nude", which is a very neutral, easy-to-use color.  I also bought the 12 hour overnight balm.  I use both together.  In just a few days, my lips (that have been raw for literally years), are HEALED!  No bleeding, no peeling, no stinging- just smooth, great-feeling lips!  And, added bonus, the balm doesn't seem to bleed into the lines around my mouth.  It is some type of voodoo magic!  This is a "can't live without" product for sure!!!

media.headline: Good product, not so good packaging
media.caption: the applicator has split from the tube

faceoff_positive.comments:
I own a ton of sheer lipsticks and balms, but I think I've finally found my holy grail lip balm! I have dry skin and like to have really moisturized lips. I'm allergic or sensitive to a lot of plant-based ingredients but not to lanolin, so this is awesome, and definitely the best I've found for the price! The plain 101 ointment is great too, but this cap opens and closes more easily/comfortably for use throughout the day, and the Perfect Nude is seriously my lip color (medium pink, and rarely pale) but better. This goes on glossy-satiny and not sticky and then sinks in for a gorgeous satiny finish that lasts a long time for a balm. No scent, no smell, just a beautiful and pleasant texture. Because of the lack of taste or fragrance, I actually prefer this to some of the comparably hydrating but more expensive balms I own (bite agave, nuxe reve de miel). I love to use this with the mlbb bite lip pencil in shade 010 for a more polished and longer-lasting nude look.

The one caveat is that this formula/packaging combo requires a bit of thought to use without mishap. The formula is very thick when it's cool, and too much will spurt out of the large hole if you squeeze the tube too hard without letting it warm up in your hands first (30 seconds to a minute should do it). I also recommend holding the tube against your lips as you squeeze to help prevent this problem. When the spurt happened to me, I used the excess over my bb cream as a surprisingly long-lasting blush, glossy highlighter, and eye gloss multiple for a really pretty and fresh nude-pink monochrome look. Those with oily skin or darker skin tones may not have luck using it this way, but I'm dry and really fair, so I love it and will definitely use this as a multiple again! I fully intend to repurchase, and will be getting the Rhubarb soon for when I feel like going darker/brighter and pinker.
faceoff_positive.headline: LOVE - virtually perfect

faceoff_negative.comments: The color is a universally flattering nude. Upon application, the color goes on okay but it does feel thick. Over a few a hours the color fades, loses shine and you get a gross rim of build up around the center of your mouth where your top and bottom lip meet. It's gross! I have keep on checking that the building is not there yet making me look like I didn't wash my face or clean my mouth in the morning. I thought this was because my lips are so dry but...isn't this supposed to be moisturizing??
faceoff_negative.headline: Good color, poor texture
